text: Back in the days when I was a rookie in the police force, the Chief was a veteran.
keypoint: I recall the Chief as a seasoned veteran

text: He had caught a notorious criminal – or had been awarded for bravery.
keypoint: He was celebrated for catching a criminal

text: But he had – a young daughter.
keypoint: The Chief had a young daughter

text: And in those days I was a fitness enthusiast. And it seemed she was trying to impress me.
keypoint: As a fitness enthusiast, she tried to impress me

text: I never observed it. Truth is I wasn't very fond of her because she was – She was a charming girl until she opened her mouth. She was a chatterbox. Goodness, she could talk.
keypoint: I was indifferent to her chatty nature

text: Then she left a message one day saying she was going to run away because he was always scolding her about me.
keypoint: She threatened to run away over scoldings

text: He arrived at my apartment. Big intimidating look on his face. I managed to calm him down.
keypoint: The Chief confronted me with a stern look

text: and proposed “Well we'll search for her and if we can't locate her well you can – do whatever you think is right.”
keypoint: I suggested searching for her together

text: I was strategizing. So he accepted my offer.
keypoint: He agreed to my plan of action

text: And we went to where they found her scarf – near a park. and we traced down a little more and we couldn't locate her.
keypoint: We searched for her but couldn't find her

text: And returned – it was a police station – she was sitting on a chair with a book in her hands. She hadn't run away. But – nevertheless – that resolved the issue for that day.
keypoint: She was at the station, not really runaway

text: But that evening the deputy, Frank Mitchell, said “You better transfer and leave because that old man never forgets anything once he gets it into his mind.” And I did. I transferred. and left.
keypoint: Advised to transfer, I left the department

text: That was the end of my rookie year.
keypoint: That marked the end of my rookie year
